intro: Cliffortia longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Cliffortia longifolia is well adapted to arid conditions and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance.
